greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, for n > 1, a(n) = n + a(n-A052126(n)).
comment: Conjecturally, also the largest path sum when iterating from n to 1 with nondeterministic map k -> k - k/p, where p is any prime factor of k.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537

Michael De Vlieger, Graph montage of k -> k - k/p, with prime p|k for 2 <= k <= 211, red line showing path of greatest sum, blue the path of least sum (cf. A333790), and purple where the two paths coincide, with other paths in gray.
formula: a(n) = n + Max a(n - n/p), for p prime and dividing n. [Conjectured, holds at least up to n=2^24]
For all n >= 1, a(n) >= A332993(n). [Apparently, have to check!]
example: For n=119, the graph obtained is this:

If we always subtract A052126(n) (i.e., n divided by its largest prime divisor), i.e., iterate with A171462 (starting from 119), we obtain 119-(119/17) = 112 -> 112-(112/7) -> 96-(96/3) -> 64-(64/2) -> 32-(32/2) -> 16-(16/2) -> 8-(8/2) -> 4-(4/2) -> 2-(2/2) -> 1, with sum 119+112+96+64+32+16+8+4+2+1 = 554, thus a(119) = 554. This happens also to be maximal sum of any path in above diagram.
program: \\ Program based on conjecture, valid at least in range n = 1 .. 2^24:
A333794_CONJ_list(up_to) = { my(v=vector(up_to)); v[1] = 1; for(n=2, up_to, v[n] = n+vecmax(apply(p -> v[n-n/p], factor(n)[, 1]~))); (v); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 05 2020
